channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Experts Who Warn of Risks Posed by Chinese Students Are Skeptical of Trump Plan
item.description: Some former spy-hunters see the State Department’s plan to revoke visas of some Chinese college students as heavy-handed and counterproductive.

item.title: ACLU Presses to Stop Trump’s Use of Alien Enemies Act in Court Brief
item.description: It was an opening salvo in what is likely to be the decisive legal battle over the president’s attempts to employ the rarely used wartime law as a cen...

item.title: Trump’s tariffs are headed for a constitutional showdown at the Supreme Court that could reshape presidential power for decades
item.description: The Trump administration appealed a ruling by a federal trade court invalidating many of the president’s recent tariffs.

item.title: World Scientists Look Elsewhere as U.S. Labs Stagger Under Trump Cuts
item.description: With the welcome mat withdrawn for promising researchers from around the world, America is at risk of losing its longstanding pre-eminence in the scie...

item.title: Blow to Biden-era Program Plunges Migrants Into Further Uncertainty
item.description: A Supreme Court ruling on Friday ended temporary humanitarian protections for hundreds of thousands of people. But it is unclear how quickly many coul...

item.title: India and Pakistan’s Air Battle Is Over. Their Water War Has Begun.
item.description: Though the two neighbors declared a cease-fire this month, a crucial water-sharing treaty remains at risk.

item.title: In Poland’s Presidential Election Runoff, Candidates Battle for Young Voters Who Don’t Like Them
item.description: A runoff election on Sunday pits a centrist against a nationalist who represent mainstream parties. The outcome is unclear given that many under 30 pr...

item.title: A Court Debates Whether a Climate Lawsuit Threatens National Security
item.description: The judge asked lawyers how a suit by Charleston, S.C., claiming oil companies misled people about climate risks, might be affected by a Trump executi...

item.title: India and Pakistan’s Air Battle Is Over. Their Water War Has Begun.
item.description: Though the two neighbors declared a cease-fire this month, a crucial water-sharing treaty remains at risk.

item.title: Hegseth, at Security Forum, Vows to Strengthen America’s Asian Alliances
item.description: In a world rattled by President Trump’s tariffs and his scorn for Western allies, the defense secretary struck a rare note of continuity on security p...

item.title: World Scientists Look Elsewhere as U.S. Labs Stagger Under Trump Cuts
item.description: With the welcome mat withdrawn for promising researchers from around the world, America is at risk of losing its longstanding pre-eminence in the scie...

item.title: Elon Musk just had his last day with DOGE, which he says became a ‘scapegoat’ for government cuts
item.description: President Trump honored the Tesla CEO with a farewell press conference in the Oval Office on Friday.

item.title: Trump doubles steel tariffs to 50%
item.description: Trump said U.S. Steel will stay an American company under a deal for Japan-based Nippon to invest in the iconic American steelmaker.

item.title: There are 500,000 more people selling their homes in the U.S. than those looking to buy them
item.description: Still, the median home price jumped 1.6% YoY last month and is sitting at $431,931.

item.title: Stocks flat after Trump says China ‘totally violated’ trade agreement with U.S.
item.description: The U.S. and China had previously agreed to a 90-day pause in which both countries would ratchet down reciprocal tariffs.
